keyword: how many calories in a pound of chicken
title: How Many Calories in a Pound of Chicken?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a pound of chicken, including protein, fat, carbs breakdown per 100g basis, totals, and preparation tweaks for accurate tracking.
h1: How Many Calories in a Pound of Chicken?
assumptions: Boneless, skinless chicken breast, cooked (roasted or grilled), no added fats, sauces, or seasonings; 1 pound ≈ 454 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, cooking method, added ingredients, and exact weight; values for breast meat—thighs or whole chicken differ. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A pound of cooked, skinless chicken breast provides ~749 kcal and ~141 g protein.

label_note: Totals are scaled from the per-100 g basis and mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Skin-on chicken breast (adds fat per 100 g)
Add 1 tbsp oil for cooking per 100 g
Use chicken thighs instead (higher fat per 100 g)

faqs.q: How many calories in a pound of cooked chicken breast?
faqs.a: Approximately 749 kcal for 1 pound (454 g) of cooked, skinless chicken breast.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a pound of chicken?
faqs.a: About 141 g of protein, making it a high-protein, low-carb option.

faqs.q: Does skin affect calories in a pound of chicken?
faqs.a: Yes, skin-on adds ~136 kcal total, bringing it to ~885 kcal per pound.

faqs.q: Are these calories for raw or cooked chicken?
faqs.a: Cooked weight; raw chicken shrinks ~25% when cooked, so raw pound would yield less cooked meat.

faqs.q: How does chicken cut impact calories per pound?
faqs.a: Breast is leanest (~749 kcal); thighs or drumsticks add 20-50% more calories due to higher fat.
